comments.author: casey952@gmx.com
comments.creator: casey952@gmx.com
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:6.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0
Build ID: 20110811165603

Steps to reproduce:

I have setup a Runbox email account for my domain adding one record of mx.runbox.com to the MX records of the domain and a SPF TXT Record v=spf1 mx include:runbox.com ~all

Thunderbird auto-setup of email settings fails to find the settings for Runbox.

A normal Runbox email @runbox.com,  Thunderbird does find it but not for your domain.

I had a look at ZOHO domain email which Thunderbird also failed to find but works for @zoho.com,  ZOHO was 2 MX records to your domain.

Thunderbird does find the email settings when your domain is on Google Apps but does not find any other providers for your domain when it does work for @runbox.com @zoho.com email address
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:6.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0
Build ID: 20110811165603

Steps to reproduce:

I have setup a Runbox email account for my domain adding one record of mx.runbox.com to the MX records of the domain and a SPF TXT Record v=spf1 mx include:runbox.com ~all

Thunderbird auto-setup of email settings fails to find the settings for Runbox.

A normal Runbox email @runbox.com,  Thunderbird does find it but not for your domain.

I had a look at ZOHO domain email which Thunderbird also failed to find but works for @zoho.com,  ZOHO was 2 MX records to your domain.

Thunderbird does find the email settings when your domain is on Google Apps but does not find any other providers for your domain when it does work for @runbox.com @zoho.com email address
So we probably need to host a config for runhost to be able to detect hosted domains.
comments.text: So we probably need to host a config for runhost to be able to detect hosted domains.
comments.creator: ludovic@hirlimann.net
comments.author: ludovic@hirlimann.net

comments.creator: casey952@gmx.com
comments.author: casey952@gmx.com
comments.text:
not sure how I would adjust the config to be runbox

for domains they use username%yourdomain.com instead of @yourdomain.com -- don't know what the % is instead of being username@yourdomain.com in the normal way.
comments.raw_text:
not sure how I would adjust the config to be runbox

for domains they use username%yourdomain.com instead of @yourdomain.com -- don't know what the % is instead of being username@yourdomain.com in the normal way.

comments.text:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<clientConfig version="1.1">
  <emailProvider id="runbox.com">
    <domain>runbox.com</domain>
    <displayName>Runbox Mail</displayName>
    <displayShortName>Runbox</displayShortName>
    <incomingServer type="imap">
      <hostname>secure.runbox.com</hostname>
      <port>993</port>
      <socketType>SSL</socketType>
      <authentication>password-encrypted</authentication>
      <username>%EMAILLOCALPART%%%EMAILDOMAIN%</username>
    </incomingServer>
    <incomingServer type="imap">
      <hostname>imap.runbox.com</hostname>
      <port>143</port>
      <socketType>STARTTLS</socketType>
      <authentication>password-encrypted</authentication>
      <username>%EMAILLOCALPART%%%EMAILDOMAIN%</username>
    </incomingServer>
    <incomingServer type="pop3">
      <hostname>secure.runbox.com</hostname>
      <port>995</port>
      <socketType>SSL</socketType>
      <authentication>password-cleartext</authentication>
      <username>%EMAILLOCALPART%%%EMAILDOMAIN%</username>
    </incomingServer>
    <incomingServer type="pop3">
      <hostname>pop.runbox.com</hostname>
      <port>110</port>
      <socketType>STARTTLS</socketType>
      <authentication>password-cleartext</authentication>
      <username>%EMAILLOCALPART%%%EMAILDOMAIN%</username>
    </incomingServer>
    <outgoingServer type="smtp">
      <hostname>secure.runbox.com</hostname>
      <port>465</port>
      <socketType>SSL</socketType>
      <authentication>password-encrypted</authentication>
      <username>%EMAILLOCALPART%%%EMAILDOMAIN%</username>
    </outgoingServer>
    <outgoingServer type="smtp">
      <hostname>secure.runbox.com</hostname>
      <port>587</port>
      <socketType>STARTTLS</socketType>
      <authentication>password-encrypted</authentication>
      <username>%EMAILLOCALPART%%%EMAILDOMAIN%</username>
    </outgoingServer>
    <documentation url="http://kundenservice.freenet.de/hilfe/email/programme/config/index.html">
      <descr lang="de">Allgemeine Beschreibung der Einstellungen</descr>
      <descr lang="en">Generic settings page</descr>
    </documentation>
    <documentation url="http://kundenservice.freenet.de/hilfe/email/programme/config/thunderbird/imap-thunderbird/imap/index.html">
      <descr lang="de">TB 2.0 IMAP-Einstellungen</descr>
      <descr lang="en">TB 2.0 IMAP settings</descr>
    </documentation>
  </emailProvider>
</clientConfig>



haven't done anything for the bits below smtp

runbox says for Thunderbird to use STARTTLS not SSL/TLS in the smtp setup page from the url up the top

no line in the code for standard smtp

comments.author: casey952@gmx.com
comments.creator: casey952@gmx.com

comments.text:
What's the documentation URL of runbox where they explain their settings?

Have you tried all of IMAP, POP3 and SMTP, *each* with both STARTTLS and SSL, as given in your config, testing that they all work? Did you also test that "Encrypted Password" works for all of them? If not, please do so.
comments.raw_text:
What's the documentation URL of runbox where they explain their settings?

Have you tried all of IMAP, POP3 and SMTP, *each* with both STARTTLS and SSL, as given in your config, testing that they all work? Did you also test that "Encrypted Password" works for all of them? If not, please do so.
comments.author: ben.bucksch@beonex.com
comments.creator: ben.bucksch@beonex.com

comments.text:
IMAP

SSL 465 works normal password - encrypted does not work -- secure.runbox.com

STARTTLS did not work any way

Standard 143 works normal password - encrypted does not work -- imap.runbox.com


POP

same as IMAP


SMTP

STARTTLS 587 works normal password - encrypted does not work -- secure.runbox.com

None 25 works - smtp.runbox.com




<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<clientConfig version="1.1">
  <emailProvider id="runbox.com">
    <domain>runbox.com</domain>
    <displayName>Runbox Mail</displayName>
    <displayShortName>Runbox</displayShortName>
    <incomingServer type="imap">
      <hostname>secure.runbox.com</hostname>
      <port>993</port>
      <socketType>SSL</socketType>
      <authentication>password-encrypted</authentication>
      <username>%EMAILLOCALPART%%%EMAILDOMAIN%</username>
    </incomingServer>
    <incomingServer type="pop3">
      <hostname>secure.runbox.com</hostname>
      <port>995</port>
      <socketType>SSL</socketType>
      <authentication>password-cleartext</authentication>
      <username>%EMAILLOCALPART%%%EMAILDOMAIN%</username>
    </incomingServer>
    <incomingServer type="pop3">
      <hostname>pop.runbox.com</hostname>
      <port>110</port>
      <socketType>STARTTLS</socketType>
      <authentication>password-cleartext</authentication>
      <username>%EMAILLOCALPART%%%EMAILDOMAIN%</username>
    </incomingServer>
    <outgoingServer type="smtp">
      <hostname>secure.runbox.com</hostname>
      <port>587</port>
      <socketType>STARTTLS</socketType>
      <authentication>password-encrypted</authentication>
      <username>%EMAILLOCALPART%%%EMAILDOMAIN%</username>
    </outgoingServer>
    <documentation url="https://support.runbox.com/index.php?_m=knowledgebase&_a=viewarticle&kbarticleid=16&nav=0">
      <descr lang="en">How do I set up my Outlook/Eudora/other client with runbox?</descr>
    </documentation>
  </emailProvider>
</clientConfig>

comments.creator: ben.bucksch@beonex.com
comments.text:
Thanks.
Does SMTP SSL Port 465 work? The docs say it should. If so, please re-add it.
Please remove pop.runbox.com STARTTLS from config, because you stated that it does not work.
You write "Premium". Is this config available to all users of runbox.com or just a subset?
comments.author: ben.bucksch@beonex.com
comments.raw_text:
Thanks.
Does SMTP SSL Port 465 work? The docs say it should. If so, please re-add it.
Please remove pop.runbox.com STARTTLS from config, because you stated that it does not work.
You write "Premium". Is this config available to all users of runbox.com or just a subset?

comments.text:
I forgot about the pop3 settings in the code,  was just about to do it.

I was getting the display name from the logo title in runbox.com,  it is a paid service for all accounts with a trial period of 30 days.


<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

  <emailProvider id="runbox.com">
    <domain>runbox.com</domain>

    <incomingServer type="imap">

comments.text:
runbox.com
 IMAP: mail.runbox.com, 993,       SSL, password-cleartext
 POP3: mail.runbox.com, 995,       SSL, password-cleartext
 SMTP: mail.runbox.com, 465,       SSL, password-cleartext
  SMTP: mail.runbox.com, 587, STARTTLS, password-cleartext
 username: 


Username Formats

 # Runbox Addresses

   If you only use a Runbox email address that looks like the one below, then your 
    username is the first part of the email address before the @ symbol.

   Email address: username@runbox.com (also @runbox.no, @runbox.us etc…)
   Username:  username

 # Using your own Domain

   If you signed up to your Runbox account using your own domain name then your 
    username will be as follows:

   Email address: username@domainyouown.com
   Username:  username%domainyouown.com (note that the @ symbol changes to a % symbol)

  Please Note: If you used your account using an @runbox email address before you added 
   your own domain name, then your Runbox username will not have changed and will be 
   the same as for @runbox email addresses (see above)




 Documentation

  Email Program Settings | Runbox help
   https://help.runbox.com/email-program-settings/
